title: Serializable Class Containing Sensitive Data
overview: Serializable classes are effectively open classes since data cannot be hidden in them. Classes that do not explicitly deny serialization can be serialized by any other class, which can then in turn use the data stored inside it.
remediation: ::PHASE:Implementation:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:In Java, explicitly define final writeObject() to prevent serialization. This is the recommended solution. Define the writeObject() function to throw an exception explicitly denying serialization.::PHASE:Implementation:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Make sure to prevent serialization of your objects.::
